name: Emerald Valley Trail
title: The Green Paradise of the North
short_description: A lush green valley trek perfect for beginners, featuring scenic river crossings.
full_description: Emerald Valley is a breathtaking trail that winds through dense pine forests and opens up into vast meadows of alpine flowers. Ideally visited in post-monsoon seasons, the air is crisp and the visibility is high. The trek includes two river crossings and a final ascent to the Sunset Point which offers a 360-degree view of the surrounding peaks.
address: Base Camp 4, Solang Valley Road, Manali

name: Cloud's End Peak
title: Above the Clouds
short_description: A challenging climb to the highest point in the district with snowy terrain.
full_description: Not for the faint-hearted, Cloud's End Peak requires significant endurance. The trail starts with a steep rocky ascent and transitions into a snowy ridge walk near the summit. The reward is an unparalleled view of the Himalayan range. Oxygen levels can dip slightly at the top, so acclimation is recommended.

name: Whispering Caves
title: History in the Rocks
short_description: A moderate trek leading to ancient limestone caves hidden in the jungle.
full_description: This trail combines nature with archeology. The path cuts through a deciduous forest rich in birdlife. The destination is a network of limestone caves containing ancient carvings. It is a humid trek, so carrying plenty of water is essential. Flashlights are required for exploring the caves.

name: Sunset Ridge
title: The Golden Hour Walk
short_description: Famous for its spectacular sunset views over the western ocean.
full_description: A relatively flat trek along the ridge of the coastal mountains. The wind speeds can be high, but the view of the sun dipping into the ocean is unmatched. It is a favorite spot for photographers and picnic lovers. The trail is well-marked and safe for families.

name: Canyon Deep
title: Into the Earth
short_description: A reverse trek descending into a river canyon with red rock formations.
full_description: Unlike most treks, this one starts at the top and descends into the canyon floor. The red rock formations are stunning against the blue sky. At the bottom runs a cool river perfect for a mid-trek dip. The climb back up is strenuous and requires good cardio fitness.
